info.title: imageapi
info.description: Image Recognition and Processing APIs let you use Machine Learning to recognize and process images, and also perform useful image modification operations.

post.summary: Transform an image into an artistic painting automatically
post.description: Uses machine learning to automatically transform an image into an artistic painting.  Due to depth of AI processing, depending on image size this operation can take up to 20 seconds.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The style of the painting to apply.  To start, try "udnie" a painting style.  Possible values are: "udnie", "wave", "la_muse", "rain_princess".

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert input image to PNG format
post.description: Converts the input image into PNG format.  Transparency is preserved when present.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert input image to JPG, JPEG format
post.description: Converts the input image into JPEG/JPG format.  Customize encoding parameters.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: Set the JPEG quality level; lowest quality is 1 (highest compression), highest quality (lowest compression) is 100; recommended value is 75

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert input image to GIF format
post.description: Converts the input image into GIF format.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert input image to Bitmap BMP format
post.description: Converts the input image into PSD format.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.description: Converts the input image into WebP format.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert input image to TIFF format
post.description: Converts the input image into TIFF format.  Supported input file formats include AAI, ART, ARW, AVS, BPG, BMP, BMP2, BMP3, BRF, CALS, CGM, CIN, CMYK, CMYKA, CR2, CRW, CUR, CUT, DCM, DCR, DCX, DDS, DIB, DJVU, DNG, DOT, DPX, EMF, EPDF, EPI, EPS, EPS2, EPS3, EPSF, EPSI, EPT, EXR, FAX, FIG, FITS, FPX, GIF, GPLT, GRAY, HDR, HEIC, HPGL, HRZ, ICO, ISOBRL, ISBRL6, JBIG, JNG, JP2, JPT, J2C, J2K, JPEG/JPG, JXR, MAT, MONO, MNG, M2V, MRW, MTV, NEF, ORF, OTB, P7, PALM, PAM, PBM, PCD, PCDS, PCL, PCX, PDF, PEF, PES, PFA, PFB, PFM, PGM, PICON, PICT, PIX, PNG, PNG8, PNG00, PNG24, PNG32, PNG48, PNG64, PNM, PPM, PSB, PSD, PTIF, PWB, RAD, RAF, RGB, RGBA, RGF, RLA, RLE, SCT, SFW, SGI, SID, SUN, SVG, TGA, TIFF, TIM, UIL, VIFF, VICAR, VBMP, WDP, WEBP, WPG, X, XBM, XCF, XPM, XWD, X3F, YCbCr, YCbCrA, YUV.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Adaptively adjust the contrast of the image to be more appealing and easy to see
post.description: Uses Gamma to adjust the contrast adaptively the way the human eye sees the world.  Results significantly improve the viewability and visual appeal of the image.

parameters.name: gamma
parameters.description: Gamma value to adjust the contrast in the image.  Recommended value is 2.0.  Values between 0.0 and 1.0 will reduce contrast, while values above 1.0 will increase contrast.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Rotate an image any number of degrees
post.description: Rotates an image by an arbitrary number of degrees

parameters.name: degrees
parameters.description: Degrees to rotate the image; values range from 0.0 to 360.0.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Crop an image to a rectangular area
post.description: Crop an image to a target rectangular area

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: The left edge of the rectangular crop area in pixels (X).

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The top edge of the rectangular crop area in pixels (Y).

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the rectangular crop area in pixels.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the rectangular crop area in pixels.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Crop an image to an circular area
post.description: Crop an image to a target circular area

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: The left edge of the circular crop area in pixels (X).

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The top edge of the circular crop area in pixels (Y).

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius of the circular crop area in pixels.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Invert, negate the colors in the image
post.description: Inverts (negates) all of the colors in the image.  If the image contains transparency, the transparency will first be removed prior to inverting the image.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Remove transparency from the image
post.description: Removes any active transparency in the image.  Effectively renders the image at the same resolution, in the same file format, over a white background, thus removing transparency.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Remove EXIF data from the image
post.description: Removes any EXIF data and profiles .

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Normalizes image rotation and removes EXIF rotation data
post.description: Automatically orients the input image based on EXIF information and then removes the EXIF information.  EXIF is an additional set of information stored in some images taken with cell phone cameras based on the orientation of the camera.  By normalizing rotation and removing EXIF data these images become much easier to process.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Add a customizeable drop shadow to an image
post.description: Add a customizeable drop shadow to the image

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: Horizontal (X) offset of the drop shadow

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Vertical (Y) offset of the drop shadow

parameters.name: sigma
parameters.description: Sigma (blur distance) of the drop shadow

parameters.name: opacity
parameters.description: Opacity of the drop shadow; 0 is 0% and 100 is 100%

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Composite two images together
post.description: Composites two input images together; a layered image onto a base image.  The first image you input is the base image.  The second image (the layered image) will be composited on top of this base image.  Supports PNG transparency.  To control padding you can include transparent pixels at the border(s) of your layered images as appropriate.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location to composite the layered images; possible values are: "center", "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "center-left", "center-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", "bottom-right"

parameters.name: baseImage
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

parameters.name: layeredImage
parameters.description: Image to layer on top of the base image.

post.summary: Composite two images together precisely
post.description: Composites two input images together; a layered image onto a base image. Position is based on distance in pixels from each side.  The first image you input is the base image.  The second image (the layered image) will be composited on top of this base image.  Supports PNG transparency.  To control padding you can include transparent pixels at the border(s) of your layered images as appropriate.  Providing multiple parameters in a single axis (for example top and bottom) is not recommended, since only one of the parameters will be used per axis.

parameters.name: baseImage
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

parameters.name: layeredImage
parameters.description: Image to layer on top of the base image.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Optional; Desired distance in pixels from the top of the base image to the top of the layered image.

parameters.name: bottom
parameters.description: Optional; Desired distance in pixels from the bottom of the base image to the bottom of the layered image.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: Optional; Desired distance in pixels from the left side of the base image to the left side of the layered image.

parameters.name: right
parameters.description: Optional; Desired distance in pixels from the right side of the base image to the right side of the layered image.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Optional; Desired width of the layered image in pixels. Leave height empty or 0 to automatically scale the image proportionally.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Optional; Desired height of the layered image in pixels. Leave width empty or 0 to automatically scale the image proportionally.

post.summary: Draw text onto an image
post.description: Draw one or more pieces of text, with customized visuals, onto an image

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Draw text parameters

post.summary: Draw a polygon onto an image
post.description: Draw one or more polygons, with customized visuals, onto an image

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Polygon drawing request parameters

post.summary: Draw a rectangle onto an image
post.description: Draw one or more rectangles, with customized visuals, onto an image

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Draw rectangle parameters

post.summary: Detect and find faces in an image
post.description: Locate the positions of all faces in an image

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect and find faces and landmarks eyes and nose and mouth in image
post.description: Locate the positions of all faces in an image, along with the eyes, eye brows, nose and mouth components of each

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Compare and match faces
post.description: Find the faces in an input image, and compare against a reference image to determine if there is a match against the face in the reference image.  The reference image (second parameter) should contain exactly one face.

parameters.name: inputImage
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on; this image can contain one or more faces which will be matched against face provided in the second image.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

parameters.name: matchFace
parameters.description: Image of a single face to compare and match against.

post.summary: Crop image to face with square crop
post.description: Crop an image to the face (rectangular crop).  If there is more than one face present, choose the first one.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Crop image to face with round crop
post.description: Crop an image to the face (circular/round crop).  If there is more than one face present, choose the first one.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect the age of people in an image
post.description: Identify the age, position, and size of human faces in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image do NOT need to be facing the camera; they can be facing away, edge-on, etc.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect the gender of people in an image
post.description: Identify the gender, position, and size of human faces in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image should be facing the camera.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Perform a guassian blur on the input image
post.description: Perform a gaussian blur on the input image

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in pixels of the blur operation; a larger radius will produce a greater blur effect

parameters.name: sigma
parameters.description: Sigma, or variance, of the gaussian blur operation

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Perform a motion blur on the input image
post.description: Perform a motion blur on the input image at a specific angle

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in pixels of the blur operation; a larger radius will produce a greater blur effect

parameters.name: sigma
parameters.description: Sigma, or variance, of the motion blur operation

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: Angle of the motion blur in degrees

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect and highlight edges in an image
post.description: Perform an edge detection operation on the input image

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in pixels of the edge detection operation; a larger radius will produce a greater effect

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Emboss an image
post.description: Perform an emboss operation on the input image

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in pixels of the emboss operation; a larger radius will produce a greater effect

parameters.name: sigma
parameters.description: Sigma, or variance, of the emboss operation

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Convert image to black-and-white grayscale
post.description: Remove color from the image by converting to a grayscale, black-and-white image

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Despeckle to remove point noise from the image
post.description: Remove point noise / despeckle the input image

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Swirl distort the image
post.description: Swirl distort the image by the specified number of degrees

parameters.name: degrees
parameters.description: Degrees of swirl

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Posterize the image by reducing distinct colors
post.description: Reduce the unique number of colors in the image to the specified level

parameters.name: levels
parameters.description: Number of unique colors to retain in the output image

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Returns the image metadata including EXIF and resolution
post.description: Returns the metadata information on the image, including file type, EXIF (if available), and resolution.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Returns the dominant colors of the image
post.description: Uses advanced image processing to extract the top 5 dominant colors in the image, returned in the order of dominance with the most-dominant color first.  These are the primary perceptual colors used in the image as perceived by a viewer.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Not safe for work NSFW racy content classification
post.description: Classify an image into Not Safe For Work (NSFW)/Porn/Racy content and Safe Content.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Describe an image in natural language
post.description: Generate an English language text description of the image as a sentence.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Find the location of a symbol in an image
post.description: Determine if an image contains a symbol, and if so, the location of that symbol in the image.

parameters.name: inputImage
parameters.description: Image file to search through for the target image.

parameters.name: targetImage
parameters.description: Image to find in the input image.

post.summary: Detect objects including types and locations in an image
post.description: Identify the position, size and description of objects in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  Detects both human people and objects in an image.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect people including locations in an image
post.description: Identify the position, and size of human people in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image do NOT need to be facing the camera; they can be facing away, edge-on, etc.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect vehicle license plates in an image
post.description: Identify the position, and size, and content of vehicle license plates in an image.  License plates should be within 15-20 degrees on-axis to the camera.  Supported image formats are JPG, PNG and BMP.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect and unskew a photo of a document
post.description: Detect and unskew a photo of a document (e.g. taken on a cell phone) into a perfectly square image.  Great for document scanning applications; once unskewed, this image is perfect for converting to PDF using the Convert API or optical character recognition using the OCR API.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

parameters.name: PostProcessingEffect
parameters.description: Optional, post-processing effects to apply to the email, default is None.  Possible values are None and BlackAndWhite (force the image into a black and white view to aid in OCR operations).

post.summary: Detect large text in a photo
post.description: Identify the position, and size of large text within a photograph.  Identify the location of large text in a photo - such as signs, titles, etc. and other forms of large, low-density text.  Not suitable for high-density text (e.g. scans of documents, receipts, etc.) for OCR purposes - for OCR, please see our Deep Learning OCR APIs.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Detect fine text in a photo of a document
post.description: Identify the position, and size of small/fine text within a photograph of a document.  Identify the location of small text in a photo - such as words and other forms of high density text.  Can be used on a scan of a document or a photograph (e.g. smartphone camera) of a document, page or receipt.  For OCR purposes - please see our Deep Learning OCR APIs.

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Resize an image
post.description: Resize an image to a specific width and specific height.  Resize is EXIF-aware.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the output image - final image will be exactly this width

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Height of the output image - final image will be exactly this height

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

post.summary: Resize an image while preserving aspect ratio
post.description: Resize an image to a maximum width and maximum height, while preserving the image's original aspect ratio.  Resize is EXIF-aware.

parameters.name: maxWidth
parameters.description: Maximum width of the output image - final image will be as large as possible while less than or equial to this width

parameters.name: maxHeight
parameters.description: Maximum height of the output image - final image will be as large as possible while less than or equial to this height

parameters.name: imageFile
parameters.description: Image file to perform the operation on.  Common file formats such as PNG, JPEG are supported.

DrawTextRequest.description: Request to draw one or more pieces of text onto an image

BaseImageBytes.description: Image to draw text on, in bytes.  You can also use the BaseImageUrl instead to supply image input as a URL

BaseImageUrl.description: Image to draw text on, as an HTTP or HTTPS fully-qualified URL

TextToDraw.description: One or more pieces of text to draw onto the image

DrawTextInstance.description: Text instance to draw on an image

FontFamilyName.description: Font Family to use.  Leave blank to default to "Arial".  Supported fonts including Arial, Calibri, Cambria, Candara, Consolas, Constantia, Corbel, Courier New, Courier Regular, Georgia, Impact Regular, Lucida, Modern Regular, Tahoma, Times New Roman, Verdana

Color.description: Color to use - can be a hex value (with #) or HTML common color name

X.description: Pixel location of the left edge of the text location

Y.description: Pixel location of the top edge of the text location

Width.description: Width in pixels of the text box to draw the text in; text will wrap inside this box

Height.description: Height in pixels of the text box to draw the text in; text will wrap inside this box

DrawPolygonRequest.description: Request to draw one or more polygons on a base image

BaseImageBytes.description: Image to draw polygons on, in bytes.  You can also use the BaseImageUrl instead to supply image input as a URL

BaseImageUrl.description: Image to draw polygons on, as an HTTP or HTTPS fully-qualified URL

PolygonsToDraw.description: Polygons to draw on the image.  Polygons are drawn in index order.

DrawPolygonInstance.description: Polygon instance to draw on an image

BorderColor.description: Border Color to use - can be a hex value (with #) or HTML common color name.  Transparent colors are supported.

BorderWidth.description: Width in pixels of the border.  Pass in 0 to draw a polygon with no border

FillColor.description: Fill Color to use - can be a hex value (with #) or HTML common color name.  Transparent colors are supported.  Leave blank to not fill the polygon.

Points.description: Points (vertices) which comprise the polygon; valid polygons must have at least 3 points

X.description: X location in pixels of this point in the polygon

Y.description: Y location in pixels of this point in the polygon

DrawRectangleRequest.description: Request to draw one or more rectangles on a base image

BaseImageBytes.description: Image to draw rectangles on, in bytes.  You can also use the BaseImageUrl instead to supply image input as a URL

BaseImageUrl.description: Image to draw rectangles on, as an HTTP or HTTPS fully-qualified URL

RectanglesToDraw.description: Rectangles to draw on the image.  Rectangles are drawn in index order.

DrawRectangleInstance.description: Rectangle instance to draw on an image

BorderColor.description: Border Color to use - can be a hex value (with #) or HTML common color name.  Transparent colors are supported.

BorderWidth.description: Width in pixels of the border.  Pass in 0 to draw a rectangle with no border

FillColor.description: Fill Color to use - can be a hex value (with #) or HTML common color name.  Transparent colors are supported.  Leave blank to not fill the rectangle.

X.description: Pixel location of the left edge of the rectangle location

Y.description: Pixel location of the top edge of the rectangle location

Width.description: Width in pixels of the rectangle

Height.description: Height in pixels of the rectangle

FaceLocateResponse.description: Results of locating faces in an image

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

Faces.description: Array of faces found in the image

FaceCount.description: Number of faces found in the image

ErrorDetails.description: Details of any errors that occurred

Face.description: Location of one face in an image

LeftX.description: X coordinate of the left side of the face

TopY.description: Y coordinate of the top side of the face

RightX.description: X coordinate of the right side of the face

BottomY.description: Y coordinate of the bottom side of the face

FaceLocateWithLandmarksResponse.description: Results of locating faces in an image

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

Faces.description: Array of faces found in the image

FaceCount.description: Number of faces found in the image

ErrorDetails.description: Details of any errors that occurred

FaceWithLandmarks.description: Location of one face in an image

LeftX.description: X coordinate of the left side of the face

TopY.description: Y coordinate of the top side of the face

RightX.description: X coordinate of the right side of the face

BottomY.description: Y coordinate of the bottom side of the face

LeftEyebrow.description: Point locations of the left eyebrow (the eyebrow cloesest to the left side of the picture)

RightEyebrow.description: Point locations of the right eyebrow (the eyebrow cloesest to the right side of the picture)

LeftEye.description: Point locations of the left eye (the eye closest to the left side of the picture)

RightEye.description: Point locations of the right eye (the eye closest to the right side of the picture)

BottomAndSidesOfFace.description: Point locations of the bottom and sides of the face (cheeks and chin)

NoseBridge.description: Point locations of the nose bridge (the vertical portion of the nose)

NoseBottom.description: Point locations of the bottom (nostrils) of the nose

LipsInnerOutline.description: Point locations of the inner outline of the lips

LipsOuterOutline.description: Point locations of the outer outline of the lips

X.description: X location, where 0 is the left-most pixel

Y.description: Y location, where 0 is the top-most pixel

FaceCompareResponse.description: Results of comparing/matching faces in an image

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

Faces.description: Array of faces found in the input image

FaceCount.description: Number of faces found in the image

ErrorDetails.description: Details of any errors that occurred

FaceMatch.description: Location of one face in an image, along with match results

LeftX.description: X coordinate of the left side of the face

TopY.description: Y coordinate of the top side of the face

RightX.description: X coordinate of the right side of the face

BottomY.description: Y coordinate of the bottom side of the face

HighConfidenceMatch.description: True if there is a high confidence match, false otherwise

MatchScore.description: Match score from 0.0 to 1.0 with higher scores indicating a greater match; scores above 0.7 indicate a match

AgeDetectionResult.description: Result from classifying the Age of people in an image

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

PeopleWithAge.description: People in the image annotated with age information

PeopleIdentified.description: Number of people identified in the image with an age

PersonWithAge.description: A person identified in an image age classification operation

FaceLocation.description: Location and other information about the person's face corresponding to this age classification

AgeClassificationConfidence.description: Confidence level of age classification; possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0; higher is better, with values > 0.50 being high confidence results

AgeClass.description: The person's age range classification result in years; possible values are "0-2", "4-6", "8-13", "15-20", "25-32", "38-43", "48-53", "60+"

GenderDetectionResult.description: Result from classifying the Gender of people in an image

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

PersonWithGender.description: People in the image annotated with gender information

PeopleIdentified.description: Number of people identified in the image with a gender

PersonWithGender.description: A person identified in an image gender classification operation

FaceLocation.description: Location and other information about the person's face corresponding to this age classification

GenderClassificationConfidence.description: Confidence level of gender classification; possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0; higher is better, with values > 0.50 being high confidence results

GenderClass.description: The person's identified gender; possible values are "Male", "Female" and "Unknown"

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

IsValidImage.description: True if the input image is a valid image file, false otherwise

Width.description: Width of the image in pixels

Height.description: Height of the image in pixels

HasTransparency.description: True if the image has transaprency in the form of an alpha channel, false otherwise

ExifProfileName.description: Name of the EXIF profile used

ExifValues.description: EXIF tags and values embedded in the image

Tag.description: Tag name for the EXIF value

DataType.description: Date type of the EXIF value

DataValue.description: Value, formatted as a string of the EXIF value

DominantColorResult.description: Result of performing a get dominant color operation

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

DominantColors.description: Dominant colors in the image, in order where most dominant color is in the first index position (0), the second most-dominant color is in index position 1 and so on

R.description: Red (R) channel pixel value of this color

G.description: Green (G) channel pixel value of this color

B.description: Blue (B) channel pixel value of this color

Successful.description: True if the classification was successfully run, false otherwise

Score.description: Score between 0.0 and 1.0.  Scores of 0.0-0.2 represent high probability safe content, while scores 0.8-1.0 represent high probability unsafe content.  Content between 0.2 and 0.8 is of increasing raciness.

ClassificationOutcome.description: Classification result into four categories: SafeContent_HighProbability, UnsafeContent_HighProbability, RacyContent, SafeContent_ModerateProbability

Highconfidence.description: Is the resulting best outcome recognition a high confidence outcome?

RunnerUpOutcome.description: Best backup ("runner up") Machine Learning outcome

ConfidenceScore.description: Scores closer to 1 are better than scores closer to 0

Description.description: English language description of the image

FindSymbolResult.description: Result of a find symbol operation on an input image

MatchScore.description: Score between 0.0 and 1.0 that measures how closely the symbol matched; scores above 0.2 are good

XLeft.description: X location of the left edge of the found location in pixels

YTop.description: Y location of the top edge of the found location in pixels

Width.description: Width of the found location in pixels

Height.description: Height of the found location in pixels

ObjectDetectionResult.description: Result of detecting objects in an image

Objects.description: Array of objects detected in the scene

ObjectCount.description: Number of objects detected in the scene

DetectedObject.description: Single object instance, and associated details, detected in an image

ObjectClassName.description: Class of the object.  Example values are "person", "car", "dining table", etc.

Height.description: Height, in pixels, of the object

Width.description: Width, in pixels, of the object

Score.description: Confidence score of detected object; possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0; values closer to 1.0 are higher confidence

X.description: X location, in pixels, of the left side location of the object, with the right side being X + Width

Y.description: Y location, in pixels, of the top side location of the object, with the bottom side being Y + Height

VehicleLicensePlateDetectionResult.description: Result of detecting vehicle license plates in an image

DetectedLicensePlates.description: License plates found in the image

DetectedLicensePlateCount.description: The number of license plates detected in the image

DetectedLicensePlate.description: License plate found in the image

LicensePlateText_BestMatch.description: Text from the license plate, highest-confidence result

LicensePlateText_RunnerUp.description: Alternate text from the license plate, based on second-highest-confidence result

LocationX.description: X location of the left edge of the license plate, starting from the left edge of the photo (X = 0)

LocationY.description: Y location of the top edge of the license plate, starting from the top edge of the photo (Y = 0)

Width.description: Width of the license plate's location in pixels

Height.description: Height of the license plate's location in pixels

LicensePlateRecognitionConfidenceLevel.description: Confidence score on a range of 0.0 - 1.0 of the accuracy of the detected license plate, with higher scores being better; values about 0.75 are high confidence

TextDetectionResult.description: Result of an operation to detect text in a photo

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

TextItems.description: Text items found in the input image

TextItemsCount.description: Count of text items found in the input image

TextItem.description: Individual instance of text occuring in an image; one piece of text

LeftX.description: Left X coordinate of the text location; 0 represents the left edge of the input image

TopY.description: Top Y coordinate of the text location; 0 represents the top edge of the input image

Width.description: Width in pixels of the text item

Height.description: Height in pixels of the text item

FineTextDetectionResult.description: Result of an operation to detect text in a photo

Successful.description: True if the operation was successful, false otherwise

TextItems.description: Text items found in the input image

TextItemsCount.description: Count of text items found in the input image

FineTextItem.description: Individual instance of text occuring in an image; one piece of text

TopLeftX.description: X coordinate of the top/left text location; 0 represents the left edge of the input image

TopLeftY.description: Y coordinate of the top/left text location; 0 represents the top edge of the input image

TopRightX.description: X coordinate of the top/right text location; 0 represents the left edge of the input image

TopRightY.description: Y coordinate of the top/right text location; 0 represents the top edge of the input image

BottomLeftX.description: X coordinate of the bottom/left text location; 0 represents the left edge of the input image

BottomLeftY.description: Y coordinate of the bottom/left text location; 0 represents the top edge of the input image

BottomRightX.description: X coordinate of the bottom/right text location; 0 represents the left edge of the input image

BottomRightY.description: Y coordinate of the bottom/right text location; 0 represents the top edge of the input image

Width.description: Width in pixels of the text

Height.description: Height in pixels of the text

Angle.description: Rotation Angle in radians of the text
